question: As per the Government of India Act of 1919, the appointment of the Simon Commission was scheduled in which year?
explanation: As per the Government of India Act of 1919, it was announced that a commission would be appointed after ten years (1929) to investigate the usefulness of the act of 1919. But the failure of the Government of India Act of 1919 and the continuous demand of Indian leaders forced the British to appoint the Simon Commission before the schedule in 1927.
